markdownRemark.html:
I enjoy the teachings and precepts of Functional Programming (FP). I enjoy the simplicity of it. That is not to say that it cannot express complex programs, but rather that it tends to force one to think of one thing at a time. One quote that unlocked the power of FP for me is be Alan J. Perlis as stated in Clojure’s rationale

It is better to have 100 functions operate on one data structure than to have 10 functions operate on 10 data structures.[1]

Notes

  1. Listed as one of the points here
